response._content:
<places total="1">
   <place place_id="kH8dLOubBZRvX_YZ" woeid="2487956"
               latitude="37.779" longitude="-122.420"
               place_url="/United+States/California/San+Francisco"
               place_type="locality"
               photo_count="156">San Francisco, California</place>
</places>

description._content: Return a list of the top 100 unique places clustered by a given placetype for a user.

error.message: Places for user are not available at this time
error._content: Places for user have been disabled or are otherwise not available.
One or more of the required parameters was not included with your request.
An invalid place type was included with your request.
An invalid Places (or WOE) identifier was included with your request.

error.message: User not logged in / Insufficient permissions
error._content: The method requires user authentication but the user was not logged in, or the authenticated method call did not have the required permissions.
The API key passed was not valid or has expired.

argument.name: api_key
argument._content: Your API application key. See here for more details.

argument.name: place_type_id
argument._content:
The numeric ID for a specific place type to cluster photos by.

Valid place type IDs are :
  • 22: neighbourhood
  • 7: locality
  • 8: region
  • 12: country
  • 29: continent

The "place_type" argument has been deprecated in favor of the "place_type_id" argument. It won't go away but it will not be added to new methods. A complete list of place type IDs is available using the flickr.places.getPlaceTypes method. (While optional, you must pass either a valid place type or place type ID.)

argument.name: place_type
argument._content:
A specific place type to cluster photos by.

Valid place types are :
  • neighbourhood (and neighborhood)
  • locality
  • region
  • country
  • continent

(While optional, you must pass either a valid place type or place type ID.)

argument.name: woe_id
argument._content:
A Where on Earth identifier to use to filter photo clusters. For example all the photos clustered by locality in the United States (WOE ID 23424977).

(While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

argument.name: place_id
argument._content:
A Flickr Places identifier to use to filter photo clusters. For example all the photos clustered by locality in the United States (Place ID 4KO02SibApitvSBieQ).

(While optional, you must pass either a valid Places ID or a WOE ID.)

argument.name: threshold
argument._content:
The minimum number of photos that a place type must have to be included. If the number of photos is lowered then the parent place type for that place will be used.

For example if you only have 3 photos taken in the locality of Montreal (WOE ID 3534) but your threshold is set to 5 then those photos will be "rolled up" and included instead with a place record for the region of Quebec (WOE ID 2344924).

argument.name: min_upload_date
argument._content: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

argument.name: max_upload_date
argument._content: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a unix timestamp.

argument.name: min_taken_date
argument._content: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.

argument.name: max_taken_date
argument._content: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date should be in the form of a mysql datetime.
